classification: Metalwork, Tools, Equipment and Utilitarian Objects
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
text: Long-necked ewers, sometimes referred to by their Sanskrit name kundika, are used to sprinkle water during a variety of Buddhist rituals in East Asia. This rare example features a dragon coiling up the handle toward a supernatural chimera (an elephant-tiger-oxen hybrid known as a baku) crouching atop the lid.
title: Ewer
